document.title: The Schwartz space and the Fourier transform

para.p:
Let
⁢ S
(
R n
)
be the collection of Schwartz functions
→
R n
C
. For
≥ p 0
and
∈ ϕ S
, write

Math.text: ((norm@(phi)) _ p) ^ 2 = (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * phi * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x)))

para.p: With the metric

Math.text: d * open-interval@(phi, psi) = (sum _ (p >= 0))@(2 ^ (- p) * ((norm@(phi - psi)) _ p / (1 + (norm@(phi - psi)) _ p)))

para.p:
S
is a Fréchet space.

For a multi-index
α
and for
∈ ϕ S
,
↦ x
⁢
x α
ϕ
( x )
belongs to
S
and we define
:
X α
→ S S
by
=
⁢
(
⁢
X α
ϕ
)
( x )
⁢
x α
ϕ
( x )
.
∈
⁢
D α
ϕ
S
and

Math.text: ((norm@(D ^ alpha * phi)) _ p) ^ 2 = (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((integral _ R)@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(D ^ (nu + alpha) * phi * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x))) less= ((norm@(phi)) _ (p + absolute-value@(alpha))) ^ 2

para.p:
Because
=
|
{ μ :
=
| μ |
k
}
|
(
-
+ n k
1
k
)
, 1 footnote 1 1 footnote 1 Arthur T. Benjamin and Jennifer J. Quinn, Proofs that Really Count: The Art of Combinatorial Proof, p. 71, Identity 143 and p. 74, Identity 149.

Math.text: absolute-value@(conditional-set@(mu, mu less= nu)) less= absolute-value@(conditional-set@(mu, absolute-value@(mu) less= absolute-value@(nu))) less= binomial@(n + absolute-value@(nu), absolute-value@(nu))

para.p: The product rule states

Math.text: D ^ nu * f * g = (sum _ (mu less= nu))@(binomial@(nu, mu) * D ^ mu * f * D ^ (nu - mu) * g)

para.p:
and with the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality we obtain for
≤
| ν |
p
,

Math.text: (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * X ^ alpha * phi)) ^ 2 = (absolute-value@((sum _ (mu less= nu))@(binomial@(nu, mu) * D ^ mu * phi * D ^ (nu - mu) * X ^ alpha))) ^ 2
(absolute-value@(D ^ nu * X ^ alpha * phi)) ^ 2
absent = (absolute-value@((sum _ (mu less= nu))@(binomial@(nu, mu) * D ^ mu * phi * D ^ (nu - mu) * X ^ alpha))) ^ 2
absent less= binomial@(n + p, p) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(mu) less= p))@((binomial@(nu, mu)) ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(D ^ mu * phi)) ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(D ^ (nu - mu) * X ^ alpha)) ^ 2)
absent less= binomial@(n + p, p) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(mu) less= p))@((binomial@(nu, mu)) ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(D ^ mu * phi)) ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(D ^ (nu - mu) * X ^ alpha)) ^ 2)

para.p: and with this

Math.text: ((norm@(X ^ alpha * phi)) _ p) ^ 2 = (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * X ^ alpha * phi * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x)))
((norm@(X ^ alpha * phi)) _ p) ^ 2
absent = (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * X ^ alpha * phi * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x)))

absent less= (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ p * binomial@(n + p, p) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(mu) less= p))@((binomial@(nu, mu)) ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(D ^ mu * phi)) ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(D ^ (nu - mu) * X ^ alpha)) ^ 2 * d * x)))

absent less= (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ p * binomial@(n + p, p) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(mu) less= p))@((binomial@(nu, mu)) ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(D ^ mu * phi)) ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(D ^ (nu - mu) * X ^ alpha)) ^ 2 * d * x)))
absent less= C _ p * ((norm@(phi)) _ (p + absolute-value@(alpha))) ^ 2
absent less= C _ p * ((norm@(phi)) _ (p + absolute-value@(alpha))) ^ 2

para.p:
For
∈
g , ϕ
S
we have
∈
⁢ g ϕ
S
, and using the product rule we get

Math.text: ((norm@(g * phi)) _ p) ^ 2 less= C _ (list@(p, g)) * ((norm@(phi)) _ p) ^ 2

para.p: Therefore,

Math.text: formulae@(phi maps-to D ^ alpha * phi, formulae@(phi maps-to X ^ alpha * phi, phi maps-to g * phi))

para.p:
are continuous linear maps
→ S S
.

For
: u
→ S C
, we write

Math.text: list@(phi, u) = u * phi

para.p:
S ′
denotes the dual space of
S
, and the elements of
S ′
are called tempered distributions. We assign
S ′
the weak-* topology, the coarsest topology on
S ′
such that for each
∈ ϕ S
the map
↦ u
⟨ ϕ , u ⟩
is continuous
→
S ′
C
.

For
∈ ψ S
, we define
:
Λ ψ
→ S C
by

Math.text: formulae@(list@(phi, Lambda _ psi) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * x * psi * x * differential-d@(x)), phi element-of S)

para.p: and by the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality,

Math.text: absolute-value@(list@(phi, Lambda _ psi)) less= ((integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(phi * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x))) ^ (1 / 2) * ((integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(psi * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x))) ^ (1 / 2) = (norm@(psi)) _ 0 * (norm@(phi)) _ 0

para.p:
whence
∈
Λ ψ
S ′
. It is apparent that
↦ ψ
Λ ψ
is linear. Suppose that
→
ψ i
ψ
in
S
, and let
∈ ϕ S
. Then

Math.text: absolute-value@(list@(phi, Lambda _ psi _ i) - list@(phi, Lambda _ psi)) = absolute-value@(list@(phi, Lambda _ (psi _ i - psi))) less= (norm@(psi _ i - psi)) _ 0 * (norm@(phi)) _ 0 to 0

para.p:
which shows that
↦ ψ
Λ ψ
is continuous. If
=
Λ ψ
0
, then in particular
=
⁢
Λ ψ
¯ ψ
0
, i.e.
=
∫
R n
⁢
|
⁢ ψ
( x )
|
2
d x
0
, which implies that
=
⁢ ψ
( x )
0
for almost all
x
and because
ψ
is continuous,
= ψ 0
. Therefore,
↦ ψ
Λ ψ
is a continuous linear injection
→ S
S ′
. It can be proved that
⁢ Λ
( S )
is dense in
S ′
. 2 footnote 2 2 footnote 2 Michael Reed and Barry Simon, Methods of Modern Mathematical Physics, volume I: Functional Analysis, revised and enlarged edition, p. 144, Corollary 1 to Theorem V.14.

For a multi-index
α
and
∈ u
S ′
, we define
:
⁢
D α
u
→ S C
by

Math.text: formulae@(list@(phi, D ^ alpha * u) = (- 1) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * list@(D ^ alpha * phi, u), phi element-of S)

para.p:
For
→
ϕ i
ϕ
in
S
, because
:
D α
→ S S
and
: u
→ S C
are continuous,

Math.text: list@(phi _ i, D ^ alpha * u) = (- 1) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * list@(D ^ alpha * phi _ i, u) to (- 1) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * list@(D ^ alpha * phi, u) = list@(phi, D ^ alpha * u)

para.p:
and therefore
∈
⁢
D α
u
S ′
.

We define
:
⁢
X α
u
→ S C
by

Math.text: formulae@(list@(phi, X ^ alpha * u) = list@(X ^ alpha * phi, u), phi element-of S)

para.p:
For
→
ϕ i
ϕ
in
S
,

Math.text: list@(phi _ i, X ^ alpha * u) = list@(X ^ alpha * phi _ i, u) to list@(X ^ alpha * phi, u) = list@(phi, X ^ alpha * u)

para.p:
and therefore
∈
⁢
X α
u
S ′
.

For
∈ g S
, we define
:
⁢ g u
→ S C
by

Math.text: formulae@(list@(phi, g * u) = list@(g * phi, u), phi element-of S)

para.p:
For
→
ϕ i
ϕ
in
S
,

Math.text: list@(phi _ i, g * u) = list@(g * phi _ i, u) to list@(g * phi, u) = list@(phi, g * u)

para.p:
and therefore
∈
⁢ g u
S ′
.

For
∈ ψ S
, integrating by parts yields

Math.text: list@(phi, D ^ alpha * Lambda _ psi) = (- 1) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * list@(D ^ alpha * phi, Lambda _ psi)
list@(phi, D ^ alpha * Lambda _ psi)
absent = (- 1) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * list@(D ^ alpha * phi, Lambda _ psi)
absent = (- 1) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(D ^ alpha * phi * x * psi * x * differential-d@(x))
absent = (- 1) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(D ^ alpha * phi * x * psi * x * differential-d@(x))
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * x * D ^ alpha * psi * x * differential-d@(x))
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * x * D ^ alpha * psi * x * differential-d@(x))
absent = list@(phi, Lambda _ (D ^ alpha * psi))
absent = list@(phi, Lambda _ (D ^ alpha * psi))

para.p:
which implies that
=
⁢
D α
Λ ψ
Λ
⁢
D α
ψ
.

Math.text: list@(phi, X ^ alpha * Lambda _ psi) = list@(X ^ alpha * phi, Lambda _ psi) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(x ^ alpha * phi * x * psi * x * differential-d@(x)) = list@(phi, Lambda _ (X ^ alpha * psi))

para.p:
which implies that
=
⁢
X α
Λ ψ
Λ
⁢
X α
ψ
.

Math.text: list@(phi, g * Lambda _ psi) = list@(g * phi, Lambda _ psi) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(g * x * phi * x * psi * x * differential-d@(x)) = list@(phi, Lambda _ (g * psi))

para.p:
which implies that
=
⁢ g
Λ ψ
Λ
⁢ g ψ
.

Because
↦ ϕ
⁢
D α
ϕ
,
↦ ϕ
⁢
X α
ϕ
, and
↦ ϕ
⁢ g ϕ
are continuous linear maps
→ S S
and because
: Λ
→ S
S ′
is a continuous linear map with dense image, using the above it is proved that

Math.tex: u\mapsto D^{\alpha}u,\qquad u\mapsto X^{\alpha}u,\qquad u\mapsto gu
Math.text: formulae@(u maps-to D ^ alpha * u, formulae@(u maps-to X ^ alpha * u, u maps-to g * u))

para.p:
are continuous linear maps
→
S ′
S ′
. 3 footnote 3 3 footnote 3 Richard Melrose, Introduction to Microlocal Analysis, http://math.mit.edu/~rbm/iml/Chapter1.pdf, p. 17.

For Borel measurable functions
:
f , g
→
R n
C
, for those
x
for which the integral exists we write

Math.text: formulae@(f * g * x = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(f * (x - y) * g * y * differential-d@(y)) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(f * y * g * (x - y) * differential-d@(y)), x element-of R ^ n)

para.p:
and for those Borel measurable
:
f , g
→
R n
C
for which the integral exists we write

Math.text: (list@(f, g)) _ (L ^ 2) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(f * x * overline@(g * x) * differential-d@(x))

para.p:
For
∈ ξ
R n
we define

Math.text: formulae@(e _ xi * x = e ^ ((2 * pi * i * xi) cdot x), x element-of R ^ n)

para.p:
and for
∈ ϕ S
we calculate, integrating by parts,

Math.text: D ^ alpha * phi * e _ xi = (2 * pi * i * xi) ^ alpha * phi * e _ xi

para.p:
We define
:
⁢ F ϕ
→
R n
C
by

Math.text: formulae@(F * phi * xi = (list@(phi, e _ xi)) _ (L ^ 2) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * x * overline@(e _ xi * x) * differential-d@(x)) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * x) cdot xi) * phi * x * differential-d@(x)), xi element-of R ^ n)

para.p: which we can write as

Math.text: phi * e _ xi * 0 = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * y * e _ xi * (- y) * differential-d@(y)) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * y * overline@(e _ xi * y) * differential-d@(y)) = F * phi * xi

para.p: By Fubini’s theorem,

Math.text: F * phi * psi * xi = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(psi * y * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * (x - y) * overline@(e _ xi * x) * differential-d@(x)) * differential-d@(y))
F * phi * psi * xi
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(psi * y * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * (x - y) * overline@(e _ xi * x) * differential-d@(x)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(psi * y * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * x * overline@(e _ xi * (x + y)) * differential-d@(x)) * differential-d@(y))
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@(psi * y * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(phi * x * overline@(e _ xi * (x + y)) * differential-d@(x)) * differential-d@(y))

para.p: whence

Math.text: F * phi * psi = F * phi * F * psi

para.p: We calculate

Math.text: F * D ^ alpha * phi * xi = D ^ alpha * phi * e _ xi * 0 = (2 * pi * i * xi) ^ alpha * phi * e _ xi * 0 = (2 * pi * i * xi) ^ alpha * F * phi * xi

para.p: whence

Math.text: F * D ^ alpha * phi = (2 * pi * i) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * X ^ alpha * F * phi

para.p: It follows from the dominated convergence theorem

Math.text: D ^ alpha * F * phi * xi = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((- 2 * pi * i * x) ^ alpha * e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * x) cdot xi) * phi * x * differential-d@(x))
D ^ alpha * F * phi * xi
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((- 2 * pi * i * x) ^ alpha * e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * x) cdot xi) * phi * x * differential-d@(x))
absent = (- 2 * pi * i) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * x) cdot xi) * x ^ alpha * phi * x * differential-d@(x))
absent = (- 2 * pi * i) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@(e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * x) cdot xi) * x ^ alpha * phi * x * differential-d@(x))
absent = (- 2 * pi * i) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * F * X ^ alpha * phi * xi
absent = (- 2 * pi * i) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * F * X ^ alpha * phi * xi

para.p: Therefore

Math.text: formulae@(F * D ^ alpha = (2 * pi * i) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * X ^ alpha * F, D ^ alpha * F = (- 2 * pi * i) ^ (absolute-value@(alpha)) * F * X ^ alpha)

para.p: Using the multinomial theorem,

Math.text: (1 + (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2 = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(binomial@(p, k) * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ (2 * k) * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2)
(1 + (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2
absent = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(binomial@(p, k) * (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ (2 * k) * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2)
absent = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(binomial@(p, k) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(alpha) = k))@(binomial@(k, alpha) * xi ^ (2 * alpha) * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2))
absent = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(binomial@(p, k) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(alpha) = k))@(binomial@(k, alpha) * xi ^ (2 * alpha) * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2))
absent = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(binomial@(p, k) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(alpha) = k))@(binomial@(k, alpha) * (absolute-value@(xi ^ alpha * D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2))
absent = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(binomial@(p, k) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(alpha) = k))@(binomial@(k, alpha) * (absolute-value@(xi ^ alpha * D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2))

para.p: Applying (),

Math.text: absolute-value@(xi ^ alpha * D ^ nu * F * phi * xi) = (2 * pi) ^ (absolute-value@(nu)) * (2 * pi) ^ (- absolute-value@(alpha)) * absolute-value@(F * D ^ alpha * X ^ nu * phi * xi)

para.p: Then

Math.text: ((norm@(F * phi)) _ p) ^ 2 = (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(xi)))
((norm@(F * phi)) _ p) ^ 2
absent = (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(xi)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(xi)))

absent = (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@(((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(binomial@(p, k) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(alpha) = k))@(binomial@(k, alpha) * (absolute-value@(xi ^ alpha * D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2 * d * xi))))

absent = (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((integral _ (R ^ n))@(((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(binomial@(p, k) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(alpha) = k))@(binomial@(k, alpha) * (absolute-value@(xi ^ alpha * D ^ nu * F * phi * xi)) ^ 2 * d * xi))))

absent = (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((2 * pi) ^ (2 * absolute-value@(nu)) * ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(binomial@(p, k) * (2 * pi) ^ (- 2 * k) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(alpha) = k))@(binomial@(k, alpha) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(F * D ^ alpha * X ^ nu * phi * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(xi)))))

absent = (sum _ (absolute-value@(nu) less= p))@((2 * pi) ^ (2 * absolute-value@(nu)) * ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ p)@(binomial@(p, k) * (2 * pi) ^ (- 2 * k) * (sum _ (absolute-value@(alpha) = k))@(binomial@(k, alpha) * (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(F * D ^ alpha * X ^ nu * phi * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(xi)))))

para.p: Applying the Plancherel theorem, the product rule, and the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality yields

Math.text: (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(F * D ^ alpha * X ^ nu * phi * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(xi)) = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(D ^ alpha * X ^ nu * phi * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(xi))
(integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(F * D ^ alpha * X ^ nu * phi * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(xi))
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@(D ^ alpha * X ^ nu * phi * xi)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(xi))
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@((sum _ (beta less= alpha))@(D ^ beta * X ^ nu * D ^ (alpha - beta) * phi))) ^ 2 * differential-d@(xi))
absent = (integral _ (R ^ n))@((absolute-value@((sum _ (beta less= alpha))@(D ^ beta * X ^ nu * D ^ (alpha - beta) * phi))) ^ 2 * differential-d@(xi))
absent less= (integral _ (R ^ n))@((sum _ (beta less= alpha))@((absolute-value@(D ^ beta * X ^ nu * xi)) ^ 2 cdot (sum _ (beta less= alpha))@((absolute-value@(D ^ (alpha - beta) * phi * xi)) ^ 2)))
absent less= (integral _ (R ^ n))@((sum _ (beta less= alpha))@((absolute-value@(D ^ beta * X ^ nu * xi)) ^ 2 cdot (sum _ (beta less= alpha))@((absolute-value@(D ^ (alpha - beta) * phi * xi)) ^ 2)))

para.p: This yields

Math.text: (norm@(F * phi)) _ p less= C _ p * (norm@(phi)) _ p

para.p:
whence
: F
→ S S
is continuous.

For
> p
/ n 2
, using the Cauchy-Schwarz inequality and spherical coordinates 4 footnote 4 4 footnote 4 http://individual.utoronto.ca/jordanbell/notes/sphericalmeasure.pdf we calculate

Math.text: absolute-value@(F * phi * xi) less= (integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ (- p / 2) * (1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ (p / 2) * absolute-value@(phi * x) * differential-d@(x))
absolute-value@(F * phi * xi)
absent less= (integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ (- p / 2) * (1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ (p / 2) * absolute-value@(phi * x) * differential-d@(x))

absent less= ((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ (- p) * differential-d@(x))) ^ (1 / 2) * ((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(phi * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x))) ^ (1 / 2)

absent less= ((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ (- p) * differential-d@(x))) ^ (1 / 2) * ((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(phi * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x))) ^ (1 / 2)

absent = (((integral _ 0) ^ infinity)@((integral _ (S ^ (n - 1)))@((1 + r ^ 2) ^ (- p) * differential-d@(sigma) * r ^ (n - 1) * differential-d@(r)))) ^ (1 / 2) * ((integral _ (R ^ n))@((1 + (absolute-value@(x)) ^ 2) ^ p * (absolute-value@(phi * x)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x))) ^ (1 / 2)
